definition: to hand over to a successor/to relinquish one's office
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to unload/to unhitch/to remove or strip/to get rid of

sentences.english: In the winter of more than two years ago, grandma died and father lost his job.
sentences.chinese: 那年冬天，祖母死了，父親的差使也交卸了。

sentences.english: This ones straight from the top.
sentences.chinese: 這是直接由上頭交卸的。

definition: official post/billet/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差事[chai1 shi5]
to send/to assign/to appoint/servants of an official/official messenger
to return to the capital
military affairs
to resign from office/to dismiss from office
to sack/to remove from a position/to depose
imperial envoy
Ministry of War (in imperial China)
to travel to take up a new post
Ministry of Appointments (in imperial China)
errand/assignment/job/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差使[chai1 shi5]
poor/not up to standard
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
inspector-general of province in Ming and Qing times
on imperial orders
Minister of Revenue (from the Han dynasty onwards)
one's office/place where one holds a post
to supervise (troops)/to appoint (officers)/to select and assign
